intro: Exostema ixoroides subsp. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leafed exostema, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually pubescent on the underside. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
